entry.title: TL;DR: Worst Apocolypse Ever; Programming with Kent Beck & OO Re-use
entry.content:
So the Mayan apocalypse was a dud... Thankfully so because it would've ruined a perfect day in Cape Town.

This week Dalibor got one step closer to his goal of Programming like Kent Beck. He also spent some time reading up on what constitutes good design and why PG thinks it's not subjective or abstract.

Ile has been beefing up his Vim skills thanks to @mislav's great post. Starting with a simple .vimrc which you fully understand will make it easier to 'get' the fundamentals.

He's also shared David Copeland's article on ways to improve reusability in your application - Re-use in OO: Inheritance, Composition and Mixins

Sachin was reading up on ways of improving your application's performance on Heroku whilst staying within budget

Wishing you well over the festive season from Siyelo!
